subject: Design
title: Gutenberg's Movable Type: Design for the Masses
description: A 60-second lesson on Gutenberg's Movable Type: Design for the Masses.

hook.text: Before 1440, a single book took months to copy by hand. Only the rich could own one.

buildup.text: Gutenberg designed individual letter blocks that could be rearranged and reused endlessly.

discovery.text: His real innovation wasn't the press â€” it was designing a system of interchangeable parts.

twist.text: Within 50 years, 20 million books existed in Europe. Before Gutenberg, there were only thousands.

climax.text: Movable type didn't just print books. It democratized knowledge itself.

punchline.text: One design system changed who gets to learn.

quiz.question: What was Gutenberg's key design innovation?
